benchmark_details.name: GlossLM (A Massively Multilingual Corpus and Pretrained Model for Interlinear Glossed Text)
benchmark_details.overview: We compile the largest existing corpus of Interlinear Glossed Text (IGT) data from a variety of sources, covering over 450k examples across 1.8k languages, to enable research on crosslingual transfer and IGT generation.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To aid in language documentation, preservation, and research by providing a large corpus of normalized IGT data and a pretrained model for automatic IGT generation.

data.source: Compiled from six different IGT corpora including ODIN, SIGMORPHON, IMTVault, APICS, UraTyp, and Guarani Corpus.
data.annotation: Data is normalized to follow a standard set of labels across languages.

methods: Pretraining on a large multilingual corpus
methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated as the number of correct glosses in the correct position compared to the gold standard.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance with respect to generating accurate glosses.
